question: 可哀想
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>possible</kanji> <kanji>pathetic</kanji> <kanji>concept</kanji>. It's not just possibly pathetic, to be honest. It's <vocabulary>pitiful</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>pathetic</vocabulary>, for sure.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. Well, at least most of it does. To remember the reading for <ja>哀</ja> imagine some <vocabulary>pathetic</vocabulary> person who lost their home. They may be <vocabulary>pitiful</vocabulary> but at some point after losing their home they decided that the hood of your car would make a fine place to live. You can't help but ask them, "<reading>Why</reading> (<ja>わい</ja>) my car?" There are so many other cars this pathetic person could be camping out on, but they chose yours.
